This is the voice of Melody Anderson, the actress who played Dale Arden, the plucky journalist and love interest for the hero. This was the highest profile role Melody would ever play.

The bass-driven intro is repeated throughout the song, whenever vocal samples from the film are featured.

This fast but steady bass groove is called “straight eighths”, and is normally a secondary part used to compliment a melody line played on another instrument.

Queen alludes to the Arthurian legend of the Holy Grail.

According to Sir Thomas Malory’s Le Morte d'Arthur, only a knight of the purest heart was able to locate the missing grail, used by Jesus Christ at the Last Supper.

The strength of Flash’s character and courage make him as unstoppable as Sir Galahad, the knight whose bravery and purity allow him to succeed in the quest for the Grail.



What makes Flash Gordon a unique comic character is that he has no powers. He is just a man. In the original comic version he’s a polo playing Yale Graduate, but his profession was revised to QB of the NY Jets for the movie.

Flash Gordon is the hero of the film, a quarterback for American rules football team The New York Jets and a Yale University graduate.



Flash was played by Sam J. Jones. Sam would never be cast in such high-profile lead role again, but he has stayed steadily employed as an actor, most recently appearing in the 2015 film Ted 2.
